sentences.english: Once upon a barren moor there dwelt a bear, also a boar.
sentences.chinese: 從前，在一個貧瘠的荒野裏住了一隻熊和一隻公野豬。

sentences.english: Want to manure the whole place over, scabby soil.
sentences.chinese: 這片土壤太貧瘠了，想整個兒施一通肥。

sentences.english: Two hundred years ago, Ascension Island was a barren volcanic edifice.
sentences.chinese: 兩百年前，阿森松島是一個貧瘠的火山結構殘跡。

sentences.english: The downpour quickly ran off the barren hills and began building up in the narrow valley.
sentences.chinese: 傾瀉的暴雨很快衝光貧瘠的山泥，小峽谷開始顯現。
連續耕作使土壤變得貧瘠。

sentences.english: And this decay impoverishes our spiritual lives.
sentences.chinese: 這種衰退讓我們的靈性生活變得貧瘠。

sentences.english: Impoverish the soil by overuse . See Synonyms at deplete.
sentences.chinese: 過度耕作而使土壤變得貧瘠參見。

sentences.english: After several years of crop rotation, the land became infertile and needed to be supplemented with organic matter.
sentences.chinese: 土地經過多年輪種變的貧瘠，需要補充有機質。

sentences.english: Without love, nothing grows and the hillsides become barren wastelands.
sentences.chinese: 沒有愛，什麼都無法生長，山坡於是成了貧瘠的荒地。

sentences.english: Both tree species hug water sources in this arid land of high plateaus and rock towers.
sentences.chinese: 在岩石成塔的高原貧瘠地帶，這兩種樹涵蓄了水源。

sentences.english: Once upon a barren moor here dwelt a bear, too a boar.
sentences.chinese: 從前，在一個貧瘠的荒野裏住了一隻熊和一隻公野豬。

sentences.english: The land is cropped and not manured , it will soon run out.
sentences.chinese: 土地種上莊稼而不施肥，很快就會變得貧瘠。

sentences.english: An admirable people wrests a living from the reluctant soil and the merciless seas.
sentences.chinese: 可敬可佩的人們從貧瘠的土地和嚴酷的大海謀求生計。

sentences.english: And heavenly love will moisten your arid soul.
sentences.chinese: 天堂般的愛會滋潤你貧瘠的靈魂。

sentences.english: We should see nothing but barren fields, overrun with weeds and briers;
sentences.chinese: 我們只會看到貧瘠的土地，野草瘋長，荊棘叢生。

definition: left to return to unchecked growth/overgrown/grown wild
no sign of human habitation (idiom); desolate
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
